text: Pope Paul III (; February 29, 1468 â€“ November 10, 1549), born Alessandro Farnese, was an Italian priest of the Roman Catholic Church and the 221st Pope from 1534 to 1549. "List of Popes," Catholic Encyclopedia (2009); retrieved 2011-11-02. ==Early life== Alessandro Farnese was born in an ancient Roman family. His grandfather was commander-in-chief of the papal troops under Pope Eugenius IV. "Pope Paul III," Catholic Encyclopedia; retrieved 2011-10-29. ==Cardinal== In 1493, Pope Alexander VI made Farnese a cardinal."Paul III," Encyclopedia Britannica (1911), pp. 955-956. ==Pope== Cardinal Farnese was elected Pope in 1534; and he chose to be called Paul III. Pope Paul was involved in Italian and European political disputes. ===Council of Trent=== He convened the Council of Trent in 1545.Society for the Diffusion of Useful Knowledge. (1833). title: Pope Paul III
